intro: Senecio glandulosolanosus, commonly known as the woolly senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly hairs on its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its growth habit is typically shrub-like with multiple branches. Senecio glandulosolanosus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
